com.tommyhasselman.termsconditions

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Application
          • com.tommyhasselman.termsconditions.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class Controller
extends android.app.Application
    Controller is an extension of the Application and hence all activities have permissions to view its variables. Which centralises main variables needed between the different main classes. It also centralises a few other simple methods such as generating a new order.

      • mapVars

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> mapVars()

      • saveExists

        public boolean saveExists(android.content.Context context)
        This is used to check if a save file is present.
        Parameters:
        context - The activity context for the file path.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a file exists with the save file name.

      • resetSave

        public void resetSave()
        This method is used to reset the game save back to defaults. It sets all vars back to default value and calls createSave() to overwrite the existing file.

      • readSave

        public void readSave(android.content.Context context)
        This method is used for reading the game save from internal storage. It reads in a serialised HashMap, deserializes it and updates Controller's data fields.
        Parameters:
        context - The activity context for the FileInputStream.

      • createSave

        public void createSave(android.content.Context context)
        This method is used for saving the state of the Controller variables. It creates a HashMap of the Controller data fields and serialises it to internal storage.
        Parameters:
        context - The activity context for the FileOutputStream.
